alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 7:41PM CST until January 01 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Falaya River At Boston St in Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Falaya River At Boston St in Covington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, The river will leave its banks under the Boston Street Bridge and begin to flood the Bogue Falaya Towers property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Saturday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 2.7 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 05/22/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
